alert.note: Alert for Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Red River County through 1000 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Manchester, or 17 miles northwest of Clarksville, moving southeast at 40 mph. Another strong storm was indicated 7 miles southeast of Parish, also moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Bogata, Bagwell, Manchester, Detroit, Deport, Annona, Negley, Cuthand, Woodland, English, Kanawha, Kiomatia, Johntown and Bryarly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
